abstract: Dalai Lama canceled a trip to South Africa; authorities did not grant him a visa in time.
snippet: Dalai Lama canceled a trip to South Africa; authorities did not grant him a visa in time.
lead_paragraph: The Dalai Lama lives in one of the so-called BRICS countries - India - and his homeland is part of another, China. And if all had gone according to plan he was to travel to the newest member of the club, South Africa, on Thursday, to celebrate the 80th birthday of his fellow Nobel Prize laureate, Archbishop Desmond M. Tutu. But he did not receive a visa in time, and has cancelled the trip, according to a statement from his office in New Delhi. Many cite warm ties between South Africa and China as the reason the Tibetan spiritual leader has gotten the cold shoulder from Pretoria. Lydia Polgreen reports. Read more »
